required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Value of Ultrasound and Computed Tomography in the Diagnosis of Acute Appendicitis With Histopathology as Gold Standard.
clinical_study.official_title: Value of Ultrasound and Computed Tomography in the Diagnosis of Acute Appendicitis With Histopathology as Gold Standard - Retrospective Cohort Study.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a retrospective evaluation of all patients treated surgically for appendicitis over a period of 3 years at the Sint- Andries Hospital, Tielt. Belgium. The goal is to evaluate the value of ultrasound (US), computed tomography (CT) and laboratory testing in diagnosing acute appendicitis and to look for the possible impact on the treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of diagnostic test
primary_outcome.description: For US and CT sensitivity and specificity for diagnosing acute appendicitis were evaluated.

intervention.description: Patients underwent US, CT or CT after US

study_pop.textblock: Patients at the emergency departement with clinical signs of acute appendicitis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- suspicion of acute appendicitis
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
